newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's Chu Kwong Ship seen in HK$200 mln IPO - sources.
newsitem.headline: HK's Chu Kwong Ship seen in HK$200 mln IPO - sources.

text.p: Freight forwarding company Chu Kwong Shipping Development Ltd is expected to raise HK$200 million after expenses in an initial public offering (IPO) of shares in Hong Kong, market sources said on Thursday.
They said the company is expected to issue 187.5 million new shares, or 25 percent of its enlarged issued share capital, at HK$1.20 per share.
The issue price will give a price-earnings multiple of 9.8 times on a fully diluted basis and 8.1 times on weighted average basis, they said.
The Hong Kong-based shipping group, which is under the supervision of Guangdong provincial government, provides cargo handling services between Hong Kong and southern coastal cities in China.
"Among the net proceeds of about HK$200 million after expenses, the majority portion of it will be for working capital," said one analyst after attending a company presentation on Thursday.
"The remaining balance is expected to be used to buy new vessels, to invest in an expressway linking Guangzhou and Foshan, to upgrade computer system and to cut debt," he said.
The IPO is expected to run from May 13 to 16 and dealing in the company shares is expected to begin on May 23, sources said.
ABN AMRO is expected to be the sponsor of the issue.
"The company forecasts its earnings to be not less than HK$83 million for the year ending in June 1997," said another analyst.

Chu Kong reported a profit of HK$83 million for the year ended in June 1996, up from HK$60 million in 1995 and HK$58 million in 1994. Turnover was HK$486 million in 1996, compared with HK$482 million in 1995 and HK$401 million in 1994.
